medical_history.chief_complaint: Delayed puberty and azoospermia in a 31-year-old man.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient presented at age 31 with symptoms consistent with delayed puberty, including sexual infantilism, scant pubic and axillary hair, and a juvenile voice. The LH level was not detectable, indicating hypogonadism associated with LH deficiency.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient has a history of hypogonadotropic hypogonadism due to isolated deficiency of LH caused by compound heterozygous mutations in the LH/H9252-subunit gene.
medical_history.family_history: The patient's heterozygous parents were clinically normal. The patientâ€™s 16-year-old sister exhibited normal pubertal development but had oligomenorrhea.
